Package Controllers

Class AppointmentMainController

java.lang.Object
Controllers.AppointmentMainController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AppointmentMainController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The appointmentMainController handles the main appointment page, including all redirect button clicks and table view population.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      initialize gets all appointments in the DB and populates the appointmentList arrayList. Once all of the appointments have been added to arrayList, it is used to populate the appointment table.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url -
      resourceBundle -

    • appointmentAddButton

      public void appointmentAddButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The add button redirects the user to the add appointment view.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • appointmentModifyButton

      public void appointmentModifyButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The modify button requires that a user first select an appointment to modify. If an appointment is selected, a new scene is created and the selected appointment is passed in to be modified in the ModifyAppointment view.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • appointmentBackButton

      public void appointmentBackButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The back button redirects the user to the main appointment page without saving any input.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • appointmentWeekRadio

      public void appointmentWeekRadio(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      The week radio button runs a query for all appointments in the DB between now and one week from now. Those appointments are then loaded into an array list, and once populated, that array list is used to set the appointment table view.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -

    • appointmentMonthRadio

      public void appointmentMonthRadio(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      The month radio button runs a query for all appointments in the DB between now and one month from now. Those appointments are then loaded into an array list, and once populated, that array list is used to set the appointment table view.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -

    • appointmentAll

      public void appointmentAll(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      The all radio button runs a query for all appointments in the DB. Those appointments are then loaded into an array list, and once populated, that array list is used to set the appointment table view.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -

    • appointmentDeleteButton

      public void appointmentDeleteButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws ClassNotFoundException, SQLException
      The delete button first requires that a user has selected an appointment they wish to delete. Once confirmed that there is a selected appointment, an alert confirming the user wishes to delete the appointment appears. If the user selects that they wish to continue, a DELETE statement is run in the DB, and the appointment main page is reloaded to reflect the dropped appointment.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent -
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException
      SQLException

    • errorAlert

      private void errorAlert(int errorCode)
      All error alerts are set here so they can be called instead of being created in each method.
      Parameters:
      errorCode -

    • localDateTimeFormatter

      public String localDateTimeFormatter(CharSequence dateToBeFormatted)
      local date time formatter takes UTC Date Time as a string and transforms it to the user's local date time. The time is formatted and returned in the standard format that I've chosen for this project.
      Parameters:
      dateToBeFormatted -
      Returns:
